text: Pilot Butte is a town in Saskatchewan, Canada. It has over 2,600 people living in it. Most people live in town but drive into the nearby city Regina to work. The town got its name after the hill (or butte) that it surrounds. Pilot Butte is sometimes known as the "Sand Capital of Canada" because of all of the sand and gravel it has. The Pilot Butte Storm are a junior ice hockey team that play in Pilot Butte. == References == Category:1882 establishments in Canada Category:Settlements in Saskatchewan Category:Towns in Canada
title: Pilot Butte, Saskatchewan
